sentences.en: A declamatory style used in opera and oratorio, similar to recitative but having greater melodic variation.
sentences.cn: 一种用在歌剧和(宗教)清唱剧中的朗诵风格, 类似于背诵,但在旋律上大不相同.

sentences.en: Haydn wrote his oratorio The Creation and another equally splendid work for voices, The Seasons.
sentences.cn: 海顿写了清唱剧《创世纪》和另一首也同样很出色的声乐作品《四季》。

sentences.en: In an oratorio, soloists take the roles of characters in a loosely constructed story while the chorus adds detail and responds to the action.
sentences.cn: 在清唱剧中，独奏者们在松散的构建故事中扮演了角色并对此做了反应。

sentences.en: It's the world's most popular oratorio.
sentences.cn: 这是世界上最流行的清唱剧。

sentences.en: Its peaks are the symphony and the oratorio.
sentences.cn: 其顶峰为交响乐和清唱剧.

sentences.en: The Glee Club decided to present an oratorio during their recital.
sentences.cn: 高兴俱乐部的决定提出的清唱剧在其演奏.

sentences.en: The orchestra and chorus performed an Easter oratorio.
sentences.cn: 乐团和合唱队表演了复活节圣乐.

sentences.en: This Christmas morning, radios around the world will play the Christmas Oratorio.
sentences.cn: 今年圣诞节早上, 世界各地的广播电台都会播放《圣诞节清唱剧》.

trans.tran_cn: （以宗教为主题的）清唱剧，神剧
trans.tran_en: a long piece of music in which a large group of people sing
